posts.post_content:
An extremely effective card in an alternate universe where Wood Elementals are the dominant creature and Laces are power cards.
  
   
Should have cost 2U - a bit cheaper than Cancel (the new standard for counterspells), but with a restriction. Now, it is a case of pay more, get less.

Posted By: Totema (6/5/2012 1:34:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think the point of this was splashibility. Mulitcolor decks were a very big theme of the block. So the ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)+ cost that counterspells famously carry was harder to come by. With only two islands on the field, you were locked out of half of your deck (if dual-colored) should you want to keep counter mana up. So I can see where R&D was coming from by adding one more colorless mana to drop one mana symbol.  
  
The "non-blue" downside seems a bit extreme to me in addition to the increased cost, though. As I already said, the block was heavy in multicolored. So that "non-blue" means four of the ten guilds of Ravanica have spells immune to this, not to mention the non-blue guilds with blue hate ([Looking at you, Gruul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=107693)).  
  
So yeah, they got over protective on this one. What would have been nice was one of the "if you paid -color-" triggers instead of the target limitation. Maybe have this backlash some damage to you unless a ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) was paid, or discard unles... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

With only two islands on the field, you were locked out of half of your deck (if dual-colored) should you want to keep counter mana up. So I can see where R&D was coming from by adding one more colorless mana to drop one mana symbol.

The "non-blue" downside seems a bit extreme to me in addition to the increased cost, though. As I already said, the block was heavy in multicolored. So that "non-blue" means four of the ten guilds of Ravanica have spells immune to this, not to mention the non-blue guilds with blue hate (Looking at you, Gruul).

So yeah, they got over protective on this one. What would have been nice was one of the "if you paid -color-" triggers instead of the target limitation. Maybe have this backlash some damage to you unless a was paid, or discard unles... (see all)
